Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.view.gui.scene.gamecomponents

Class CharacterModalManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.view.gui.scene.gamecomponents.CharacterModalManager
public class CharacterModalManager extends Object
Manager for the character invocation modal

  • Field Details

    • top

      private final javafx.scene.layout.HBox top
      The modal header. It contains a title and che close button

    • center

      private final javafx.scene.layout.Pane center
      The main content of the modal

    • onSubmit

      private final BiConsumer<CharacterModalManager,Tuple<CharacterType,List<Map<String,String>>>> onSubmit
      Callback called when the "submit" button is clicked

    • onClose

      private final Runnable onClose
      Runnable called when the modal is closed either via the "close" button or the close()

    • steps

      private final javafx.collections.ObservableList<Map<String,javafx.beans.value.ObservableObjectValue<String>>> steps
      An observable list containing String to Observable string maps. Each will be translated into a String-String map and then into steps by the modal user.

    • characterName

      private final javafx.beans.property.StringProperty characterName
      The name of the character that the modal is referring to. Used ad the title of the modal.

    • viewport

      private javafx.scene.layout.VBox viewport
      The pane where each element of the modal is actually injected. It is set as the content node of a ScrollView that will be the actual child of center

  • Constructor Details

    • CharacterModalManager

      public CharacterModalManager(javafx.scene.layout.HBox top, javafx.scene.layout.Pane center, BiConsumer<CharacterModalManager,Tuple<CharacterType,List<Map<String,String>>>> onSubmit, Runnable onClose)
      Creates a new instance with the given parameters.

      Before using, a call to initialize() is necessary to set up the environment the modal will be shown into.

      Parameters:
      top - the modal header
      center - the main content of the modal
      onSubmit - callback called when the "submit" button is clicked
      onClose - Runnable called when the modal is closed either via the "close" button or the close()
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Sets up the environment and makes this manager ready for action

    • initTop

      private void initTop()
      Sets up the modal header

    • initViewport

      private javafx.scene.layout.VBox initViewport()
      Sets up the modal viewport
      Returns:
      a VBox

    • showFor

      public void showFor(Character character)
      Displays the invocation modal for the given character
      Parameters:
      character - the character to invoke
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if character is null

    • makeStep

      private javafx.scene.Node makeStep(boolean removable, CharacterType type)
      Creates a step Node for the given character
      Parameters:
      removable - true if the step should be removable
      type - the type of Character
      Returns:
      a Node

    • makeStepBlueprint

      private javafx.scene.Node makeStepBlueprint(boolean removable, CharacterType type, Map<String,javafx.beans.value.ObservableObjectValue<String>> step)
      Creates the UI for a step of the given character type. The interface will store its data in the given map.
      Parameters:
      removable - true if the step should be removable
      type - the type of Character
      step - the Map each property will be stored keyed by its name (as reported by CharacterType)
      Returns:
      a new Node

    • makeRemoveButton

      private javafx.scene.Node makeRemoveButton(Map<String,javafx.beans.value.ObservableObjectValue<String>> step)
      Creates a remove button for the given step
      Parameters:
      step - the step to remove
      Returns:
      a new Node

    • makeStepLabel

      private javafx.scene.control.Label makeStepLabel(String paramName)
      Creates the label for a step property
      Parameters:
      paramName - the name of the property
      Returns:
      a new Label

    • makeStepInput

      private Tuple<javafx.scene.Node,javafx.beans.value.ObservableObjectValue<String>> makeStepInput(CharacterType.ParameterType type)
      Creates a step input Node of the given type
      Parameters:
      type - the type of input to make
      Returns:
      a Tuple containing the Node created an ObservableObjectValue pointing to the user-selection

    • makePieceColorInput

      private Tuple<javafx.scene.Node,javafx.beans.value.ObservableObjectValue<String>> makePieceColorInput()

      Returns:
      a Tuple containing the Node created an ObservableObjectValue pointing to the user-selection

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the modal, cleaning up internal state. onClose is then called.
